entry.title: China pumps $14bn in cash into market amid Evergrande crisis

media:group.media:title: China pumps $14bn in cash into market amid Evergrande crisis
media:group.media:description:
China's Evergrande Group - the world’s most indebted real estate developer - has offered to pay back some of its investors with some of its properties. The company has been struggling to raise funds to pay debts estimated at $300bn. If it fails it could affect China's economy - the world's second-largest - but China pumped more cash into its banking system on Friday to avert a liquidity squeeze. Al Jazeera's Laura Burdon-Manley reports.

entry.title: 'Hotel Rwanda' hero Paul Rusesabagina awaits sentencing

media:group.media:title: 'Hotel Rwanda' hero Paul Rusesabagina awaits sentencing
media:group.media:description:
The man whose story inspired the Hollywood film Hotel Rwanda will find out if he is going to spend 25 years in prison. Paul Rusesabagina is credited with saving hundreds of lives during the genocide in 1994. He has since become a vocal critic of President Paul Kagame and is now facing terrorism charges. Al Jazeera's Malcolm Webb reports from Kigali, Rwanda.

entry.title: UN General Assembly: World leaders meet in New York before summit

media:group.media:title: UN General Assembly: World leaders meet in New York before summit
media:group.media:description:
The United Nations and the United Kingdom are convening a high-level meeting on climate change. The goal is to build momentum before the COP-26 summit in Glasgow this November. Al Jazeera's diplomatic editor James Bays reports.

entry.title: Lava pours from Canary Islands’ volcano, villages evacuated

media:group.media:title: Lava pours from Canary Islands’ volcano, villages evacuated
media:group.media:description:
Thousands of people have been told to leave their homes after a volcanic eruption on the Spanish Canary Islands. It follows a week of increasing seismic activity on the island of La Palma, 500km (310 miles) off the coast of West Africa. Al Jazeera's Alexi O'Brien reports.

entry.title: The boxing star Manny Pacquiao to run for Philippines president

media:group.media:title: The boxing star Manny Pacquiao to run for Philippines president
media:group.media:description:
Philippine boxing star Manny Pacquiao says he will run for president in next year’s election. He was nominated as a candidate by a faction of the governing PDP-Laban party. Al Jazeera's Dorsa Jabbari reports.

entry.title: Trudeau makes final appeal ahead of Canada’s election

media:group.media:title: Trudeau makes final appeal ahead of Canada’s election
media:group.media:description:
As Canadians head to the polls on Monday in a snap parliamentary election, polls show that Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's Liberal Party is just slightly ahead of the rival Conservative Party. Trudeau warned that a Conservative Party win would set the battle against COVID-19 back but critics say he is bringing up the pandemic to gain political mileage. He hopes to turn his minority government into a majority. Al Jazeera's Jody Vance reports from Montreal, Canada.

#AlJazeeraEnglish #Canada #Election

entry.title: Pro-Putin party heads for Russian parliamentary election win

media:group.media:title: Pro-Putin party heads for Russian parliamentary election win
media:group.media:description:
Polls have closed across Russia, after a third and final day of parliamentary elections. Early results show United Russia, which backs President Vladimir Putin, has the most votes, with 38 percent. Most Kremlin critics were barred from running after a year of crackdowns.
Al Jazeera’s Bernard Smith reports from Moscow, Russia.
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#Russia #RussianElections #DumaElections

entry.title: Israel recaptures last two Palestinian prison escapees in Jenin

media:group.media:title: Israel recaptures last two Palestinian prison escapees in Jenin
media:group.media:description:
Israeli police have now recaptured all six Palestinian prisoners who recently escaped from a maximum-security facility. The last two, Munadel Infai’at, and Ayham Kamamji, were arrested in Jenin in the occupied West Bank on Sunday, ending a two-week search. Prosecutors want to add another 15 years to each man's sentence on charges they were planning a new attack.
Al Jazeera’s Harry Fawcett reports from the occupied West Bank.
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#Israel #GilboaPrison #IsraelPrisonBreak

entry.title: Could Tunisia's political crisis deepen? | Inside Story

media:group.media:title: Could Tunisia's political crisis deepen? | Inside Story
media:group.media:description:
Tunisia's political crisis began in July when the President sacked the prime minister, suspended parliament and assumed executive power. Kais Saied insisted it was not a coup. Two months on, he still has not named a prime minister, nor revealed plans for reform. And he has extended his powers until further notice. On Saturday, protesters angry at the president faced supporters who insisted Saied was carrying out the people's will. So what is next for Tunisia?
Presenter: Imran Khan
Guests: Amel Azzouz - Ennahda party member. Mohamed-Dhia Hammami - Political Science Researcher, Syracuse University’s Maxwell School. Cherif El Kadhi - Political Commentator.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#Tunisia #KaisSaied #TunisiaProtests

entry.title: Boxer Manny Pacquiao to run for Philippine president in 2022

media:group.media:title: Boxer Manny Pacquiao to run for Philippine president in 2022
media:group.media:description:
Philippines boxing icon Manny Pacquiao says he will run for president in the 2022 election after railing against government corruption and what he calls President Rodrigo Duterte’s cosy relationship with China. Pacquiao is currently a senator, He was nominated by a faction of the ruling party. It comes after a rival faction named Christopher “Bong” Go, a senator and longtime aide of Duterte as its choice. The faction also named Duterte as its vice president nominee. Duterte is barred by the constitution from running for a second term, but may run for vice president.
Criselda Yabes is an author and journalist based in Manila. She joins us by Zoom to discuss the latest updates.
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#PhilippinesElection2022 #Duterte #MannyPacquiao

entry.title: UNICEF launches appeal for Afghan children

media:group.media:title: UNICEF launches appeal for Afghan children
media:group.media:description:
Children sick with measles and malnutrition are filling up hospitals across Afghanistan. UNICEF has launched an appeal for $200m, warning that with declining health supplies and a lack of proper treatment; many children could die.
Al Jazeera’s Hashem Ahelbarra reports from the Afghan capital, Kabul.
- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/ - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/ - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#AfghanistanHumanitarianCrisis #TalibanTakeover #Afghanistan

media:group.media:title: Last two escaped Palestinian prisoners captured | Newsfeed
media:group.media:description:
Israeli police have captured the last two of six Palestinian prisoners who escaped from a high-security facility, ending a two-week manhunt - but not without some pushback.

entry.title: Farmers in Qatar combat climate change with sustainable farming

media:group.media:title: Farmers in Qatar combat climate change with sustainable farming
media:group.media:description:
Farmers in Qatar are changing their ways to adapt to climate change. Many are turning to alternative methods to make food production more sustainable and encouraging others to do the same. Al Jazeera's Jillian Wolf reports from Al-Shahaniya, Qatar.

entry.title: US steps up plan to expel Haitian migrants from Texas border city

media:group.media:title: US steps up plan to expel Haitian migrants from Texas border city
media:group.media:description:
Thousands of undocumented Haitian migrants who crossed into the United States are to be deported. An estimated 13,000 people are staying at a makeshift camp in the Texas border town of Del Rio. Al Jazeera's John Holman reports from Acuna, Mexico.

entry.title: Last two escaped Palestinian prisoners surrender to Israel forces

media:group.media:title: Last two escaped Palestinian prisoners surrender to Israel forces
media:group.media:description:
Israel says it has captured the last two Palestinian prisoners who escaped from a maximum-security prison more than 10 days ago. The jailbreak embarrassed Israel’s security establishment but delighted Palestinians who see members of armed groups jailed by Israel as heroes in the struggle for statehood in the West Bank, Gaza and East Jerusalem, territory Israel captured in the 1967 Middle East war.
